page.title: 13BEAUTIFUL BALMEDIE BEACH
page.content: Our group feels that Balmedie beach is a very popular place. There are a lot of sand-dunes about 20 metres high. The children like playing on them and jumping off into the soft sand. There are shelves in the sea which means there are different levels of water. You must be careful when playing in the sea , not to go too far out. There used to be a Ranger called Dan Hale but he left and John Easton replaced him. The rangers look after the plants and animals. There are army huts that have survived since 1945. Many people come to look at the sea. There are a lot of picnic areas, people can have barbeques on the beach. There are barbeque pits which are supplied by the rangers. There are walkways made of planks which lead through the dunes to the beach.
